units.title: Crypt isolation and initial organoid embedding
units.text: Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise procedure to isolate intestinal crypts and start organoid culture.

units.title: Electroporation for LGR5 reporter knock‑in
units.text: Two LGR5-targeting sgRNAs were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids (a gift from Hui Yang lab), generating LGR5 sgRNA plasmids and HDR template were co-electroporated into human intestinal organoids using a NEPA21 electroporator (Nepa Gene) following published methods45.
units.rationale: Provides the actionable method for introducing a fluorescent reporter into organoids.

units.title: Organoid passage: dissociation and re‑embedding
units.text: Established organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re-embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48-well plate.
units.rationale: Details how to passage organoids for continued culture.

units.title: EdU proliferation labeling
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (5-ethynyl-2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour.
units.rationale: Specifies the labeling step to assess cell proliferation.

units.title: Paneth cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Lists the small‑molecule cocktail and timing to drive Paneth cell fate.

units.title: Goblet cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Provides the conditions to induce goblet cell differentiation.

units.title: Enteroendocrine cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) for 2 days, and then DMH1 (2 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Gefitinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the sequential small‑molecule treatment to generate enteroendocrine cells.

units.title: Enterocyte differentiation protocol
units.text: Enterocytes. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), IWR-1 (2 μM), VPA (0.75 mM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the factor mix used to promote enterocyte maturation.

units.title: M cell induction protocol
units.text: M cell. TNF-α (50 ng/mL) treated for the first 4 hours and RANKL (100 ng/mL) for total 3 days.
units.rationale: Outlines the cytokine treatment to generate M cells.

units.title: Screening of CRISPR‑edited colonies by Western blot
units.text: Colonies from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and screened by Western blotting using an MBD3 antibody (1:200, Santa Cruz).
units.rationale: Details the validation step for edited organoid lines.
